newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - August 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - August 1.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Manila newspapers on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Gasoline prices are going up by an average of 47 centavos per litre effective today, the biggest increase since the government fully deregulated the oil industry in February. Oil firms say they raised prices to recover losses arising from the recent peso devaluation. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)

- Manila Mayor Alfredo Lim is stopped temporarily by the Pasig regional trial court from continuing his spray-painting of suspected drug pushers' houses to hound them out of the city. (STANDARD/CHRONICLE/INQUIRER)
- Drug lords are behind the smear campaign against politicians to divert attention from the government's determined campaign against illegal drugs, President Ramos says. (JOURNAL/BULLETIN)

- Philippine Long Distance Telephone Co posts a net profit of 3.75 billion pesos for the first half of 1997, an increase of 28.6 percent from the year-earlier 2.92 billion despite intensified competition in the industry. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)

- The move of the central bank to lower the limit on long dollar positions of banks to five percent from 10 percent of capital is expected to release some $200 million into the system, central bank governor Gabriel Singson says. (INQUIRER/BULLETIN)
- San Miguel Corp made a profit of 2.89 billion pesos during the first six months of 1997, an increase of 20 percent from 2.41 billion pesos in the same period last year. (ALL NEWSPAPERS)
